metaDescription: Train ASL Fingerspelling ML Model using Tensorflowjs
name: ASL Fingerspelling Tutorial ðŸ‘‹

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: Load preprocessed data by pressing the button
trainTutorialSteps.name: loadData

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: creating a feed-forward model. We will use 5 layers with relu activation function. Function must return the model.
trainTutorialSteps.name: createModel

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: edit function configureModel() by using the Tf.compile API. We will use an adam optimizer, and add correct loss function.
trainTutorialSteps.name: configureModel

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: edit function trainModel() by using the Tf.fit API. Set the following parameters: epochs, batchSize,validationData, callbacks. Hint, you may need to transform your data into tensors
trainTutorialSteps.name: trainModel

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: Remove tensors used for model training
trainTutorialSteps.name: cleanupTensors

trainTutorialSteps.helperText: Click the button to download your shiney new model. We will use this in our webapp.
trainTutorialSteps.name: exportModel

predictSteps.helperText: Import a pre-trained model to perform inference with.
Extract the hand joint positions from within an image.
Normalize the joint positions from -1 to 1.
Run inference with the normalized joint positions to get a classification (ASL sign).
Cleanup the tensors used while infering.
